message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on embryology for help. The presence of cytotrophoblast and syncytiotrophoblast marks the time when implantation would normally occur, which happens around day 6 after fertilization. The embryoblast, which consists of two layers of cells, is surrounded by the trophoblast. The inner layer of cells is the hypoblast, which forms the yolk sac and begins to line the blastocyst cavity. Therefore, the correct answer is (B) Hypoblast.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on embryology for help. The cell layers referred to in the question indicate that the organism is at the blastocyst stage. The hypoblast is the layer of cells that begins to line the blastocyst cavity, while the epiblast gives rise to the embryonic disc. The endoderm is one of the germ layers that forms during gastrulation. The syncytiotrophoblast is involved in implantation and nutrient exchange but does not line the blastocyst cavity. Therefore, the correct answer is (B) Hypoblast.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on embryology for help. The situation described is that of a blastocyst stage embryo, where the blastocyst cavity is formed within the embryoblast. The layer of cuboidal cells, known as the hypoblast, will become the lining of the blastocyst cavity. The epiblast will give rise to the embryo proper, while the endoderm and syncytiotrophoblast will develop later during gastrulation and implantation.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on embryology for help. The presence of cytotrophoblast and syncytiotrophoblast marks the time of implantation, and the presence of columnar and cuboidal cells separated by a membrane suggests the embryoblast stage. Within the embryoblast, the hypoblast layer will give rise to the lining of the blastocyst cavity, while the epiblast will differentiate into the embryonic disc and the other germ layers. The endoderm layer arises from the epiblast. The syncytiotrophoblast layer does not line the blastocyst cavity but instead contributes to the formation of the placenta. Therefore, the correct answer is (B) hypoblast.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on embryology for help. The cell layer that begins to line the blastocyst cavity is the hypoblast. The epiblast gives rise to the three germ layers (endoderm, mesoderm, and ectoderm), while the syncytiotrophoblast and cytotrophoblast form the outer layer of the blastocyst that will later form the placenta.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on embryonic development for help. During embryonic development, the hypoblast (also known as primitive endoderm) starts to line the blastocyst cavity, separating it from the blastocoel. The epiblast will form the embryo proper, and the endoderm will ultimately give rise to internal organs. The syncytiotrophoblast and cytotrophoblast form the outer layer of the blastocyst, which will develop into the placenta.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on embryology for help. The presence of a cytotrophoblast and syncytiotrophoblast indicates that implantation into the uterus would normally occur, but the exact date of fertilization is unknown. Within the embryoblast, the cells are separated by a membrane, suggesting the presence of the bilaminar embryonic disc. The hypoblast is the layer that begins to line the blastocyst cavity, while the epiblast will form the three germ layers and the embryonic disc. The endoderm will form the lining of the digestive and respiratory tracts. The syncytiotrophoblast is not involved in lining the blastocyst cavity, but rather in facilitating implantation and producing hormones to support the pregnancy. Therefore, the correct answer is (B) Hypoblast.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on embryonic development for help. In embryonic development, the first cell differentiation occurs between the inner cell mass and the outer trophoblast layer. The inner cell mass then differentiates into the epiblast and hypoblast layers. The hypoblast eventually forms the yolk sac and the epiblast forms the embryo. The epiblast, endoderm, and syncytiotrophoblast do not line the blastocyst cavity, so the correct answer is (B) Hypoblast.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on embryology for help. The inner cell mass of the blastocyst differentiates into two layers, the epiblast and the hypoblast. The hypoblast layer begins to line the blastocyst cavity, while the epiblast gives rise to the embryonic disc. The syncytiotrophoblast and cytotrophoblast contribute to the formation of the placenta, while the endoderm is derived from the epiblast and gives rise to the lining of the digestive and respiratory tracts.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on embryology for help. The presence of cytotrophoblast and syncytiotrophoblast suggests that implantation has already occurred. Within the embryoblast, the layer of columnar and cuboidal cells separated by a membrane is the bilaminar germ disc, which consists of the hypoblast and the epiblast. The hypoblast is the layer that lines the blastocyst cavity, while the epiblast gives rise to the three germ layers (ectoderm, mesoderm, and endoderm) during gastrulation. Therefore, the correct answer is (B), hypoblast.
